About us

Experience

Our people have worked in the UK financial services sector for more than 20 years and have experience across multiple risk types. They’ve been part of strategic change programmes, supported policy review and implementation following regulatory changes, as well as embedding business wide enhancements of Risk Management Frameworks and Risk & Control Self-Assessment processes, including increasing colleague capability by designing and providing training.

Application

By leveraging this expertise, we can help you and your business with a wide range of requirements. Our real specialism is Operational Risk and Operational Resilience where we can provide independent assurance on change programmes, ensuring internal policy and external regulation are met. We can perform root cause analysis on risk and breach events, including those requiring escalation to the ICO, and where confidentiality is critical / NDA required for particularly sensitive cases.

Approach

We are passionate about getting it right first time, keeping it simple, and wherever possible, thinking about innovation or enhanced system infrastructure / blue print to assist with automation, as well as colleague capability and any communication as required. Ultimately, we are here to support you achieving success and making a real difference to your colleagues, business and your customers.

Resilience
A real opportunity for simplification and standardisation

Operational Resilience

Within the UK, there is a more regulatory focus and scrutiny on Operational Resilience that ever before. Financial institutions are now required to do more in this space, and clear guidelines and expectations have been set by the FCA and PRA, which now need to be met.

Those firms in scope of these regulations, need to have performed the initial assessments by March 2022, and should now be working towards the March 2025 deadline. This will take time and the various complexities of your firms structure, will bring with it some unique challenges, however this should also been seen as a real opportunity for simplification and standardisation, and perhaps just lifting the lid on topics and process which have not had much visibility previously.

If you are looking for some SME guidance or support for a specifics project, or a programme of activities you intend to complete by March 2025, please reach out. We are more than happy to talk through your requirements and build out bespoke options for you, to ensure value add, as well as regulatory compliance.

Although the UK regulation is very much focused on the financial services sector, the principles are sound and can be considered best practice which could be applied across any sector. If you have appetite to apply these types standards to how you do business, then please do get in touch.

creating a no blame culture

Operational Risk

Supporting you

Operational Risk runs through everything you do in your business and can occur within any process or activity. It is therefore critical that operational risks are quickly identified, assessed, managed and reported. Having worked in operational risk for many years, we can help you identify where enhancements to your processes can be made following an event or breach, or support you in creating a more robust operational risk framework and control environment.

Although there is a significant focus on operational risk within the banking and finance sector, these types of risks can occur in any sector, in any business, as they are driven by inadequate process, failed controls or systems, as well as from both internal or external events.

Identifying risk

We have extensive experience in providing operational risk training to embed a better understanding of why these risks need to be reported. We can help you identify and understand volumes and values of such risk events, trends and potentially unidentified hot spots, as well as creating a no blame culture to encourage more reporting. If these types of risk go unreported, then its impossible to fix them and improve the risk profile / landscape, and prevent reoccurrence.

complementing your project management resource

Project Support and Governance

Our approach

We can complement your project management resource by providing specialist SME knowledge on risk identification, mitigation, control creation, governance and oversight / assurance. We can assist your programme leads with the interpretation of internal policy and the complexities of external regulation, including Data Protection and GDPR, to ensure that there are no unintended breaches or ICO reportable events when running change activities, partially those which are handling large amounts of personal data.
